Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian pottery krater; interior reserved; exterior slipped cream: two friezes separated by a band with traces of added white lines; glaze fired light orange-brown; above, collapsing boar to right; slight remains at left break; incised and blob rosettes as fill; below, probable metopal frieze, sets of verticals alternating with another motif.
Curator's comments: Very likely from the same piece as 1924,1201.990, hence a krater. Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1888.215 probably belongs.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.416)
